meanings.definition: A tongue-shaped organ covered with rows of tiny teeth or denticles, found in most mollusks.
meanings.sent1: The radulas of the snail helps it scrape food off surfaces.
meanings.sent2: She studied the radulas of various mollusks in her biology class.
meanings.sent3: The radulas of the oyster threw a tiny party to celebrate its uniqueness.
meanings.sent4: The radulas of the clam worked tirelessly, like a tiny conveyor belt of teeth.
meanings.sent5: The radulas of the octopus were as sharp as a row of miniature saws.

meanings.sent1: Careful examination revealed the radulas of the sea snail to be intricate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the radulas under a microscope to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The radulas of the mussel told jokes to entertain the other sea creatures.
meanings.sent4: The radulas of the scallop moved in harmony, like a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent5: The radulas of the squid gleamed under the light, resembling a line of tiny pearls.
